item.title: Lodestone Network [New Layout and Code Updated:18/12/12]
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

I added the top ones because i knew exactly where to add them but for the ones below i do not really get where to add them please help me i know this sounds really dumb of me but it would be really great if anyone could help me and tell me the exact locations to add these

Save and compile Next part is the improved code by Arham 4
so in Clicking Buttons above the swich statement, add this

Code: [Select]

if (Lodestone.getButtonID() == actionButtonId) {
c.startAnimation(714);
c.getPA().startTeleport(Lodestone.getX(), Lodestone.getY(), 0, “modern”);
}
[\code]

and with the imports add

[code]import sever.content.Lodestone;

Noe go to your content folder in there make a new file and name it Lodestone.java, and add this

Code: [Select]
package server.content;

Code: [Select]

/**

  • All data for Lodestones.
  • @author Arham 4

*/
public class Lodestone {

/**

  • Data for clicked buttons.
    */
    public static int[][] buttons = { { 102111, 3093, 3493 },
    { 102108, 3210, 3424 }, { 102117, 3023, 3208 },
    { 102129, 2606, 3093 }, { 102120, 3093, 3244 },
    { 102126, 2813, 3447 }, { 102132, 2724, 3484 },
    { 102096, 2926, 3559 }, { 102105, 3303, 3123 },
    { 102093, 3222, 3218 }, { 102099, 3176, 2987 },
    { 102114, 2965, 3380 }, { 102123, 2663, 3310 },
    { 102090, 2135, 3942 }, };

/**

  • Get the button ID.
  • @return
    */
    @SuppressWarnings(“unused”)
    public static int getButtonID() {
    for (int i = 0; i < buttons.length; i++)
    return buttons[i][0];
    return 0;
    }

/**

  • Get the X coordinate to teleport to.
  • @return The X coordinate.
    */
    @SuppressWarnings(“unused”)
    public static int getX() {
    for (int i = 0; i < buttons.length; i++)
    return buttons[i][1];
    return 0;
    }

/**

  • Get the Y coordinate to teleport to.
  • @return The Y coordinate.
    */
    @SuppressWarnings(“unused”)
    public static int getY() {
    for (int i = 0; i < buttons.length; i++)
    return buttons[i][2];
    return 0;
    }
    }

or if you want you could email me please: "piratemann7@gmail.com"[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Lodestone Network [New Layout and Code Updated:18/12/12]

But ycou can add it anywhere, items objects etc…

if i open home teleport nothing happens only that i can teleport to 3 different home locations and that isn’t the lodestone network thingy
[/quote]

Get the action utton id and search it in clickingbuttons and make it open the lodestone stuff[/quote]
ok
